oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Vacancy-mediated room-temperature ferromagnetism in Zn(1-x)Mn(x)O thin films
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GOPALAKRISHNAN, N
BALAKRISHNAN, L
SRIMATHY, B
KUMAR, MS
BALASUBRAMANIAN, T
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mn-doped zno
magnetic semiconductors
electronic-structure
zno
doping
manganese
ferromagnetism
vacancies
sputtering
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effect of oxygen vacancies on ferromagnetism (FM) in Zn(1-x)Mn(x)O thin films grown by radio frequency (RF) sputtering has been investigated. The grown films at different oxygen pressures have been characterized by X-ray diffraction (XRD), Hall effect, photoluminescence (PL) and vibrating sample magnetometry (VSM). The observed ferromagnetism/diamagnetism by the VSM measurement due to the variation of oxygen vacancies has been confirmed by XRD, PL, and Hall results. The vacancy-mediated FM has been explained by the formation of magnetic polarons. (C) 2010 WILEY-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: PHYSICA STATUS SOLIDI A-APPLICATIONS AND MATERIALS SCIENCE, 207(9), 2180-2184
